meanings.definition: A factor that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the patient's allergy was a contraindication for the medication.
meanings.sent2: It is important for healthcare providers to be aware of any contraindications before starting a new treatment.
meanings.sent3: The contraindication to eating spicy food was having a sensitive stomach.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights acted as a contraindication to climbing the tall tower.
meanings.sent5: The contraindication to swimming in the ocean was the presence of dangerous jellyfish.

meanings.definition: An existing condition that makes a certain treatment or procedure potentially harmful.
meanings.sent1: The patient's heart condition was a contraindication for the surgery.
meanings.sent2: Before prescribing any medication, doctors must consider any contraindications the patient may have.
meanings.sent3: The contraindication to staying up late was feeling tired the next day.
meanings.sent4: His lack of experience was a contraindication to taking on the challenging project.
meanings.sent5: The contraindication to using the new software was the risk of data loss.
